definition: Johannes Kepler (1571-1630), German astronomer and formulator of Kepler's laws of planetary motion

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to rein in/to compel/to force/to carve/to engrave/(literary) to command/to lead/bridle/(physics) abbr. for 勒克斯[le4 ke4 si1], lux

sentences.english: Kepler will hunt for transiting planets that are as small as Earth.
sentences.chinese: 開普勒將尋找像地球這麼小的行星。

sentences.english: Kepler has reserve fuel if NASA extends the mission.
sentences.chinese: 開普勒攜帶着儲備燃料用於任務擴展。

sentences.english: Then through Kepler's laws of motion, it's possible to calculate the mass of the star.
sentences.chinese: 然後通過議案開普勒定律，它可以計算出恆星的質量。

sentences.english: Three great eyes on kepler's supernova remnant .
sentences.chinese: 開普勒超新星遺蹟中的大三眼。
